Understate: The claim may understate the impact of funding on the lack of an automatic braking system, suggesting that it was not a significant factor.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully substantiate the assertion that funding was not a driving factor in the absence of the braking system.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of an automatic braking system was solely due to the time it takes to implement, without considering other potential factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the absence of the automatic braking system, such as potential delays or challenges in implementation that were not solely related to funding.
